intro: Girardinia adoensis, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has a woody stem and heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full to partial sunlight. Girardinia adoensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique nocturnal blooming habit.
